problem: Determine how many integers satisfy the inequality $|2x - 3| \leq 15$.
solution:
To solve the inequality $|2x - 3| \leq 15$, we consider two cases: 

1. $2x - 3 \leq 15$, solving this gives $2x \leq 18$, hence $x \leq 9$.
2. $-(2x - 3) \leq 15$, which simplifies to $2x - 3 \geq -15$, and then $2x \geq -12$, so $x \geq -6$.

Combining these inequalities, we get $-6 \leq x \leq 9$. The integers satisfying this inequality range from $-6$ to $9$, inclusive. Thus, there are $9 - (-6) + 1 = 16$ integers in total. Therefore, the number of integer solutions is $\boxed{16}$.
